layer.name: Order
layer.definition: Reality has patterns that can be discovered and used.

questions.text: Objective moral order — right and wrong as real things — is ...
questions.principle: Moral reality exists independently of opinion

answers.4: generally real — most moral truths exist objectively
answers.5: foundational — right and wrong exist independent of opinion
answers.2: uncertain — maybe there's something, but I can't be sure
answers.3: partially real — some things are truly wrong, others are preference
answers.1: a fiction — morality is just personal preference

questions.text: Moral truth can be discovered through reason, revelation, and conscience ...

answers.4: generally — these are reliable guides to moral reality
answers.5: absolutely — God gave us tools to know right from wrong
answers.3: sometimes — some truths seem discoverable, others not
answers.1: not really — morality is constructed, not discovered

questions.text: The consistency of conscience across cultures and history suggests ...
questions.principle: Universal moral patterns indicate moral reality

answers.4: an ordered moral reality that humans can access
answers.5: clear evidence of moral order built into creation
answers.2: maybe something — but I'm not convinced
answers.3: some underlying reality — but with lots of variation
answers.1: nothing — it's coincidence or social conditioning

questions.text: The idea that morality is purely constructed or arbitrary is ...

answers.4: mostly wrong — there's real moral order underlying things
answers.5: completely wrong — moral order is as real as physical order
answers.2: probably true — I don't see evidence otherwise
answers.3: partly true — some morality is constructed, some isn't
answers.1: accurate — morality is a human invention

questions.text: Living in alignment with moral order leads to flourishing ...

answers.4: generally — moral alignment usually produces good outcomes
answers.5: reliably — this is how reality is structured
answers.2: sometimes — but the connection is weak
answers.3: often — there's some pattern, but with many exceptions
answers.1: not necessarily — good people suffer, bad people thrive
